docs.text: an entertaining 2 hours awaits the audience in this film set in the early 80's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sevigny and beckinsale play disco chicks alice and charlotte , who are on the lookout for love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alice is mousy , shy , intellectual , charlotte is bitchy , out-going and fun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we join their adventures as they go through a variety of adventures , and men , all to the background of the local disco .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: whit stillman has both written and directed an interesting and believable story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alice and charlotte are both well written characters , and the actresses who play them aren't bad aswell .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sevigny delivers an honest performance , and makes the audience feel for her character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: beckinsale plays extreme bitch personified , yet her character never becomes completely unlikeable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the huge supporting cast also play a part in making sure this movie is thoroughly entertaining .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dialogue is sharp and well written , with many funny set pieces .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for example , there's a great discussion about lady & the tramp by the main characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the disco tunes playing in the background also make sure that this admittedly long film is good fun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the direction is good , bringing out the drama and comedy in the scenes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but their are slight flaws with the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: firstly , although it is supposedly set in the 80's , the characters are very , very 90's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the way they dress and act have a very 90's feel to them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although the male hairstyles look slightly 80's , frankly the 80's atmosphere just wasn't conveyed , which is a shame .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , as mentioned above , the film is too long , and some parts do lag .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the charm of the characters do help these moments , but generally the editing could of been a bit tighter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the plot also side-tracks into a silly cocaine dealing bust , which seemed out of place in this movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: finally , their are almost too many characters in the film , and despite the running time , the film never really spends enough time on them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some of the characters are very slight , which is a shame .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the conclusion , while funny , is also surprisingly weak , and certainly not strong enough .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but despite these qualms , the last days of disco is a funny , warm movie , which is certainly worth seeing , and is a fitting homage to the disco era of the 80's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: worth a look .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall rating=
docs.label: positive

docs.text: review by david wilcock ? 1998
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " you know , for kids " - norville barnes
docs.label: positive
